definition: boiled balls of glutinous rice flour, eaten during the Lantern Festival
soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled
circle/round/circular/spherical/(of the moon) full/unit of Chinese currency (yuan)/tactful/to make consistent and whole (the narrative of a dream or a lie)

sentences.english: The oil temperature should control about three tenths, avoids fries in oil when the sweet dumplings served in soup bursting.
sentences.chinese: 油温应控制在三成左右，以避免油炸时汤圆破裂。

sentences.english: This is a northern custom. Those of use from the south like to eat tangyuan.
sentences.chinese: 这是你们北方人的习惯，我们南方人在这天都吃汤圆。

sentences.english: So people eat them to denote union, harmony and happiness for the family.
sentences.chinese: 因此人们吃汤圆来表联盟，家庭和谐与幸福。

sentences.english: Tangyuan is made from glutinous rice flour.
sentences.chinese: 汤圆是由糯米粉做成的。

sentences.english: I port view, view lamp puzzles to eat dumplings.
sentences.chinese: 火树银花不夜天，观灯猜谜吃汤圆。

sentences.english: Maggie: It's sweet dumplings made of glutinous rice flour.
sentences.chinese: 是一种用糯米粉做成的甜汤圆。

sentences.english: A year older folk have "eat tangyuan" said.
sentences.chinese: 民间有“吃了汤圆大一岁”之说。

sentences.english: It looks like Tang-yuan, but its colour is green.
sentences.chinese: 艾粑粑看起来像汤圆，但它的颜色的是绿色的。

sentences.english: The traditional food of the festival is sweet dumplings, which symbolize reunion.
sentences.chinese: 汤圆又称元宵，象征着一家老小团团圆圆，幸福完美。

sentences.english: During the Lantern Festival, people will try to solve the puzzles on the lanterns and eat yuanxiao (glutinous rice ball).
sentences.chinese: 在元宵节期间，人们会试着猜灯谜，吃汤圆。

sentences.english: Actually, they are small dumpling balls made of glutinous rice flour. They are like Tangyuan.
sentences.chinese: 其实呢，它们是用糯米粉做的小圆球，有点像汤圆。

sentences.english: What is the name of dumplings?
sentences.chinese: 汤圆这个名字是怎么来的呢？

sentences.english: sticky rice balls with peanut or sesame inside.
sentences.chinese: 有花生或芝麻馅的汤圆。

sentences.english: In Southern China, people have Tangyuan for the dinner at the eve of Lantern Festival.
sentences.chinese: 在中国南方的有些地方，元宵节的晚饭多是吃汤圆。

sentences.english: In Southern China, people have Tangyuan for the dinner at the eve of Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 在中国南方的有些地方，人们年夜饭是吃汤圆。

sentences.english: We usually eat rice dumplings on the Lantern Festival.
sentences.chinese: 我们通常在元宵节吃汤圆。

definition: Lantern Festival/night of the 15th of the first lunar month/see also 元夜[yuan2 ye4]/sticky rice dumplings
nian gao, New Year cake, typically a sweet, steamed cake made with glutinous rice flour
Laba congee, ceremonial rice porridge dish eaten on the 8th day of the 12th month in the Chinese calendar
